result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory A Timmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gregory A Timmons is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gregory A Timmons was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gregory A Timmons appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter in court for Gregory A Timmons. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
